abstracts.cdata!:
In late October 2000, the areas of West
            Bank and Gaza under Palestinian authority jurisdiction
            became subject to a tight border closure by Israel, causing
            a severe shock to the Palestinian economy. In response, the
            Bank in December 2000 launched an emergency response program
            (ERP) with a 12 million dollars grant to ease the harshest
            effects of the closure by offering temporary jobs to
            Palestinian workers. Designed by the Bank in cooperation
            with village councils, municipalities, and Palestinian
            authorities' agencies, the program has so far created
            more than 190,000 direct person days of work for
            Palestinians in West Bank and Gaza through 232 micro projects.
